short_summary: The project involves roadway improvements on Lake Louise Drive, including resurfacing and line painting, signage and barrier replacement, intersection reconfiguration and civil grading, roadway structure repairs, and more.
description: This is a two-stage selection process. Bidders responding to this selection process are requested to submit a bid in two stages. This posting is the first stage (Stage One) of a two-stage solicitation process: the first stage will evaluate the qualifications of all interested Suppliers; the second stage (Stage Two) will invite the qualified Suppliers to provide further qualifications and a financial bid on the project based on the specifications and drawings. Upon award of contract in Stage Two the pre-qualification list will expire and will not be used in any other solicitation. The qualification list will expire within 180 days or upon award of a contract in Stage Two, whichever is earlier, and the prequalification list will not be used in any other solicitation.

full_summary:
**Lake Louise Drive Roadway Improvement**
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0300/A
**Publication Date:** January 31, 2024
**Tender Closing Date:** February 15, 2024, at 16:00 hours

**Introduction**

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit their qualifications for the Lake Louise Drive Roadway Improvement project, located in Lake Louise, Alberta. This is a two-stage selection process, with Stage One evaluating the qualifications of interested suppliers, and Stage Two inviting qualified suppliers to submit further qualifications and a financial bid.

**Project Description**

The scope of work includes, but is not limited to: asphalt resurfacing and line painting, signage and barrier replacement, intersection reconfiguration and civil grading, roadway structure repairs, electrical streetlighting and conduit installations, and drainage improvements.

**Requirements**

To be considered, bidders must demonstrate their ability to deliver the work by November 1, 2024. The project's estimated value exceeds $5,000,001, exclusive of taxes.

**Indigenous Benefits**

Parks Canada encourages bidders to partner with Indigenous businesses as part of this project. Bidders participating in Stage Two will be evaluated on their commitment to using Indigenous subcontractors or procuring supplies and equipment from Indigenous suppliers.

**Submissions**

Parks Canada accepts bids by fax or email only. Bidders must submit their bid through the Government of Canada's Tendering Service at [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities). Bidding documents may be downloaded from this website. Late submissions will not be considered.

**Technical and Contractual Enquiries**

All technical and contractual enquires must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority.

**Additional Information**

The National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

**Government of Canada's Tendering Service**

Bidders are responsible for obtaining the bidding documents from the Government of Canada's Tendering Service at [canadabuys.canada.ca](http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities). This service is the sole source of bidding information. Any bidding documents obtained from other sources are the bidder's responsibility.
